title: Matthew Chapter 18 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Matthew chapter 18 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Matthew Chapter 18 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Matthew Chapter 18.

questions.question: Who did Jesus call unto Him and set in the midst of the disciples?
questions.correctAnswer: A little child
questions.explanation: Jesus called a little child unto him and set him in the midst of them, as stated in Matthew 18:2.

questions.question: What must one become to enter the kingdom of heaven, according to Jesus?
options: Converted and become as little children
questions.correctAnswer: Converted and become as little children
questions.explanation: Jesus said that except ye be converted, and become as little children, ye shall not enter into the kingdom of heaven (Matthew 18:3).

questions.question: What is said about the one who humbles himself as a little child?
options: The same is greatest in the kingdom of heaven
questions.correctAnswer: The same is greatest in the kingdom of heaven
questions.explanation: Whosoever shall humble himself as this little child is greatest in the kingdom of heaven (Matthew 18:4).

questions.question: Who does one receive when receiving a little child in Jesus' name?
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus
questions.explanation: Whoso shall receive one such little child in my name receiveth me (Matthew 18:5).

questions.question: What is worse than offending one of the little ones who believe in Jesus?
options: Better for him a millstone were hanged about his neck and drowned
questions.correctAnswer: Better for him a millstone were hanged about his neck and drowned
questions.explanation: Jesus stated it were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck and that he were drowned in the depth of the sea (Matthew 18:6).

questions.question: What should one do if their hand or foot offends them?
options: Cut them off and cast them from thee
questions.correctAnswer: Cut them off and cast them from thee
questions.explanation: Jesus instructs to cut off and cast away any offending hand or foot to enter into life, rather than be cast into everlasting fire (Matthew 18:8).

questions.question: According to Matthew 18:10, whose angels always behold the face of the Father in heaven?
questions.correctAnswer: The angels of little ones
questions.explanation: In heaven their angels do always behold the face of my Father which is in heaven, referring to the little ones (Matthew 18:10).

questions.question: In the parable of the lost sheep, how many sheep does the man leave to seek the one gone astray?
questions.correctAnswer: Ninety and nine
questions.explanation: He leaves the ninety and nine to go into the mountains to seek the one which is gone astray (Matthew 18:12).

questions.question: What should you do if your brother trespasses against you and hears you when you tell him his fault?
questions.correctAnswer: You have gained your brother
questions.explanation: If he shall hear thee, thou hast gained thy brother (Matthew 18:15).

questions.question: What happens if a brother trespasses and will not hear you or the church according to Jesus?
options: Let him be unto thee as an heathen man and a publican
questions.correctAnswer: Let him be unto thee as an heathen man and a publican
questions.explanation: If he neglect to hear the church, let him be unto thee as an heathen man and a publican (Matthew 18:17).

questions.question: True or False: According to Matthew 18:20, Jesus said He is present where two or three are gathered together in His name.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Jesus said where two or three are gathered together in my name, there am I in the midst of them (Matthew 18:20).

questions.question: True or False: Jesus told Peter to forgive his brother only up to seven times.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Jesus said not until seven times, but until seventy times seven (Matthew 18:22).

questions.question: True or False: The king in the parable forgave the servant's great debt because the servant asked for patience.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The lord was moved with compassion and forgave the debt after the servant asked for patience (Matthew 18:27).

questions.question: Complete this verse from Matthew 18:35: 'So likewise shall my heavenly Father do also unto you, if ye from your hearts _______ not every one his brother their trespasses.'
questions.correctAnswer: forgive
questions.explanation: The verse says that the heavenly Father will act if ye from your hearts forgive not every one his brother their trespasses (Matthew 18:35).

questions.question: According to the parable in Matthew 18, how much did the servant owe the king?
questions.correctAnswer: Ten thousand talents
questions.explanation: The servant owed the king ten thousand talents according to Matthew 18:24.

medium.title: Matthew Chapter 18 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Matthew Chapter 18 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with pride and wants to know how to be great in the kingdom of heaven. Based on Matthew 18, what biblical truth would you share?
options: Be converted and become like little children
questions.correctAnswer: Be converted and become like little children
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:3-4 teach that to be great in the kingdom of heaven, one must humble themselves and become like little children, emphasizing humility and trust. This is foundational for Christian character.

questions.question: How does Matthew 18 teach us to respond when a brother sins against us and refuses to listen after private correction?
options: Take one or two more witnesses to establish the matter
Ignore the sin and avoid the person
End the relationship without further attempts
questions.correctAnswer: Take one or two more witnesses to establish the matter
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:15-16 instructs believers to first confront privately, then involve one or two witnesses if the offender does not listen, showing a biblical process for reconciliation and accountability.

questions.question: According to Matthew 18, what should be the attitude toward 'little ones' who believe in Jesus?
options: Do not despise them because their angels always see God's face
Consider them insignificant in the church
questions.correctAnswer: Do not despise them because their angels always see God's face
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:10 warns against despising little ones, emphasizing their value by noting their angels behold the Father's face, teaching respect and care for all believers, especially the vulnerable.

questions.question: What does Matthew 18 teach about forgiveness when Peter asked how often to forgive a brother who sins against him?
questions.correctAnswer: Forgive seventy times seven times
questions.explanation: In Matthew 18:21-22, Jesus teaches that forgiveness should be abundant and continual, beyond human limits, encouraging a heart of mercy and grace toward others.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to hold grudges and not forgive debts. Based on the parable in Matthew 18, what biblical principle would you share?
options: We must forgive others as God forgives us
We should seek revenge for unpaid debts
Forgiveness is optional depending on the offense
Only forgive if the person deserves it
questions.correctAnswer: We must forgive others as God forgives us
questions.explanation: The parable in Matthew 18:23-35 illustrates that God forgives our great debts and expects us to forgive others from the heart, warning of consequences if we refuse mercy.

questions.question: How does Matthew 18 teach us to deal with sin or temptation in our own lives?
options: Remove or cut off anything that causes sin to avoid greater punishment
Ignore the temptation and hope it goes away
Rely on others to help with temptation
questions.correctAnswer: Remove or cut off anything that causes sin to avoid greater punishment
questions.explanation: Verses 8-9 advise drastic measures to avoid sin, symbolizing the importance of personal discipline and the serious consequences of unrepented sin.

questions.question: What assurance does Jesus give about prayer when two believers agree on something asked in His name?
options: It will be done by the Father in heaven
It requires sacrifices to be answered
God will delay the answer until perfect timing
It depends on the number of people praying
questions.correctAnswer: It will be done by the Father in heaven
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:19 promises that when two agree in prayer about anything, God will answer, highlighting the power of united prayer and faith.

questions.question: What does Matthew 18 teach about the presence of Jesus when believers gather together?
options: Jesus is present where two or three gather in His name
Jesus only appears to large crowds
Jesus is present only in the temple
Presence depends on the holiness of the believers
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus is present where two or three gather in His name
questions.explanation: Verse 20 assures believers that Jesus is spiritually present in any gathering of two or three in His name, encouraging fellowship and worship even in small groups.

questions.question: According to Matthew 18, what is the appropriate first step to take when a brother trespasses against you?
options: Tell him his fault between you and him alone
Ignore the fault and pray silently
questions.correctAnswer: Tell him his fault between you and him alone
questions.explanation: Verse 15 emphasizes private correction as the first step toward reconciliation, reflecting love and respect in resolving conflicts.

questions.question: What consequence does Matthew 18 mention for those who cause 'little ones' who believe to sin or stumble?
options: It would be better for them to have a millstone hung around their neck and be drowned
They will be ignored by the church
They will receive only a warning
They will be publicly shamed but forgiven
questions.correctAnswer: It would be better for them to have a millstone hung around their neck and be drowned
questions.explanation: Verse 6 states the severe judgment for causing believers to sin, highlighting the seriousness of influencing others toward wrongdoing.

questions.question: True or False: Matthew 18 says that the kingdom of heaven is not for those who are proud but for those who humble themselves like little children.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verses 3-4 teach that humility, like a child's, is essential to enter the kingdom of heaven, emphasizing the value of humility in Christian life.

questions.question: True or False: According to Matthew 18, a believer should only forgive a brother’s sins up to seven times.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Jesus corrects Peter in verse 22, saying to forgive not just seven times but seventy times seven, teaching unlimited forgiveness.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: In Matthew 18, Jesus says, 'Whatsoever ye shall bind on earth shall be bound in heaven: and whatsoever ye shall loose on earth shall be ______ in heaven.'
questions.correctAnswer: loosed
questions.explanation: Verse 18 explains the authority given to the church in binding and loosing, affirming the spiritual connection between earthly and heavenly decisions.

questions.question: What does Matthew 18 teach about God's attitude toward a lost sheep that has gone astray?
options: God rejoices more over the one found than the ninety-nine that did not stray
God is indifferent to the one lost
God punishes the lost sheep severely
God leaves the lost sheep forever
questions.correctAnswer: God rejoices more over the one found than the ninety-nine that did not stray
questions.explanation: Verses 12-13 illustrate God's joy in restoring a lost believer, encouraging evangelism and care for those who wander from faith.

questions.question: Based on Matthew 18, what is the consequence for a servant who refuses to forgive a fellow servant after being forgiven much himself?
options: He is handed over to the tormentors until he pays all that is due
He is praised for his strictness
He is forgiven again without conditions
He is promoted in the kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: He is handed over to the tormentors until he pays all that is due
questions.explanation: Verses 34-35 warn that refusing to forgive others after receiving forgiveness leads to severe judgment, teaching the necessity of mercy.

hard.title: Matthew Chapter 18 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Matthew Chapter 18.

questions.question: In Matthew 18:3, Jesus says one must become like what to enter the kingdom of heaven?
questions.correctAnswer: A little child
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:3 states that one must become like a little child to enter the kingdom of heaven, emphasizing humility and innocence.

questions.question: What is the consequence described in Matthew 18:6 for causing one of the little ones who believe in Jesus to stumble?
options: Better to have a millstone hung about his neck and be drowned
questions.correctAnswer: Better to have a millstone hung about his neck and be drowned
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:6 warns that offending a little one who believes in Jesus merits a severe punishment likened to being drowned with a millstone around one's neck.

questions.question: What metaphor does Jesus use in Matthew 18:12-13 to illustrate God's concern for the lost?
options: A shepherd leaving ninety-nine sheep to find one that is lost
A farmer sowing seeds on good soil
A king searching for a lost coin
A fisherman catching fish in a net
questions.correctAnswer: A shepherd leaving ninety-nine sheep to find one that is lost
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:12-13 uses the parable of a shepherd seeking one lost sheep to illustrate God's care for every individual who has gone astray.

questions.question: According to Matthew 18:15-17, what is the correct order of steps to address a brother who sins against you?
options: Tell him privately, then with witnesses, then the church
Tell the church first, then witnesses, then privately
Tell witnesses first, then privately, then the church
questions.correctAnswer: Tell him privately, then with witnesses, then the church
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:15-17 outlines a progression from private confrontation, to bringing one or two witnesses, and ultimately involving the church if the offender refuses to repent.

questions.question: What promise is given in Matthew 18:19 when two agree on earth about anything they ask?
options: It will be done for them by the Father in heaven
questions.correctAnswer: It will be done for them by the Father in heaven
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:19 assures that agreement in prayer by two believers will result in answered requests by God the Father.

questions.question: What does Jesus emphasize about his presence in Matthew 18:20 when two or three are gathered in his name?
options: He is in the midst of them
questions.correctAnswer: He is in the midst of them
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:20 emphasizes Jesus' spiritual presence among believers gathered in his name, indicating fellowship and authority.

questions.question: In Matthew 18:22, Jesus tells Peter to forgive how many times?
questions.correctAnswer: Seventy times seven
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:22 records Jesus instructing Peter to forgive not just seven times, but seventy times seven, symbolizing boundless forgiveness.

questions.question: The parable in Matthew 18:23-35 about the unforgiving servant primarily teaches about what theme?
questions.correctAnswer: Forgiveness from the heart
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:23-35 uses the parable to illustrate that God expects believers to forgive others sincerely as He forgives them.

questions.question: What does the Greek term translated as 'converted' in Matthew 18:3 imply in a theological context?
options: A radical change of heart or repentance
questions.correctAnswer: A radical change of heart or repentance
questions.explanation: The Greek word for 'converted' (ἐπιστρέψῃ) in Matthew 18:3 signifies a deep turning or repentance necessary to enter God's kingdom.

questions.question: How does the warning about cutting off hand, foot, or plucking out eye in Matthew 18:8-9 function literarily?
options: As hyperbolic imagery emphasizing radical sin avoidance
questions.correctAnswer: As hyperbolic imagery emphasizing radical sin avoidance
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:8-9 uses exaggeration to stress the importance of removing sin from one's life at any cost to avoid eternal punishment.

questions.question: In Matthew 18:10, what is the role of angels in relation to 'these little ones'?
options: They always behold the face of the Father in heaven on their behalf
They guide them to earthly leaders
questions.correctAnswer: They always behold the face of the Father in heaven on their behalf
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:10 teaches that angels watch over believers, especially the humble and trusting little ones, reflecting divine care and advocacy.

questions.question: True or False: According to Matthew 18:18, what is bound or loosed on earth will also be bound or loosed in heaven.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:18 affirms the spiritual authority given to believers where earthly decisions in matters of discipline and forgiveness correspond with heavenly endorsement.

questions.question: Which Old Testament concept is reflected in the parable of the unforgiving servant in Matthew 18:23-35?
questions.correctAnswer: Jubilee forgiveness of debts
questions.explanation: The parable echoes the Jubilee year concept from Leviticus 25, where debts were forgiven, symbolizing God's mercy and the expectation of mercy among His people.

questions.question: How does Matthew 18:14 express God's will regarding 'these little ones' and their fate?
options: It is not His will that any should perish
He allows some to be lost
Only the righteous will be saved
questions.correctAnswer: It is not His will that any should perish
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:14 emphasizes God's desire that no humble believer, especially the vulnerable 'little ones,' should perish, reflecting the theme of divine mercy.

questions.question: What cultural or historical insight helps explain the severity of the punishment described in Matthew 18:6?
options: Millstones were large and heavy, symbolizing an unbearable penalty
Drowning was a common form of execution for blasphemy
Necklaces were worn as symbols of honor
questions.correctAnswer: Millstones were large and heavy, symbolizing an unbearable penalty
questions.explanation: In ancient Near Eastern culture, a millstone was a massive grinding stone, so being drowned with one tied to the neck symbolized a severe, inescapable punishment.

theological.title: Matthew Chapter 18 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Matthew Chapter 18 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Matthew 18, what attitude must one adopt to enter the kingdom of heaven?
questions.correctAnswer: Become as a little child
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches in Matthew 18:3-4 that unless one is converted and becomes like a little child, they cannot enter the kingdom of heaven. This highlights humility and dependence, consistent with teachings in Mark 10:15, Luke 18:17, Psalm 131:2, and Isaiah 66:2.

questions.question: What does Jesus say about receiving a little child in His name?
options: Receiving them is receiving Jesus Himself
It is a minor act of kindness
It is not necessary for salvation
It is only for the disciples
questions.correctAnswer: Receiving them is receiving Jesus Himself
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:5 states that whoever receives a little child in Jesus' name receives Him. This reflects Christ's identification with the lowly and is echoed in Matthew 25:40, Mark 9:37, Luke 9:48, and Hebrews 13:2.

questions.question: What warning does Jesus give regarding causing a 'little one' who believes in Him to stumble?
options: It is better for that person to have a millstone hung around their neck and be drowned
They will be excluded from the church
questions.correctAnswer: It is better for that person to have a millstone hung around their neck and be drowned
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:6 warns that offending a believer, especially a child, carries grave consequences, emphasizing the seriousness of causing spiritual harm. This aligns with teachings in Mark 9:42, Luke 17:2, Proverbs 6:16-19, and Ezekiel 18:4.

questions.question: What does Jesus say about cutting off a hand or plucking out an eye if they cause one to sin?
options: It is better to lose a part of the body than to be cast into everlasting fire
One should endure sin without drastic measures
Sin is not serious enough for such action
questions.correctAnswer: It is better to lose a part of the body than to be cast into everlasting fire
questions.explanation: In Matthew 18:8-9, Jesus uses hyperbolic language to emphasize removing sin-causing elements from one's life to avoid eternal punishment, consistent with Romans 6:13, 1 Corinthians 5:6, Colossians 3:5, and Revelation 21:8.

questions.question: Why should believers not despise 'one of these little ones' according to Jesus?
options: Because their angels always behold the face of God in heaven
Because they are weak and need protection
Because they can be easily influenced
Because they belong to the church
questions.correctAnswer: Because their angels always behold the face of God in heaven
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:10 teaches the special divine care for believers, especially the vulnerable, as their angels are in God's presence. This reflects angelic ministry in Hebrews 1:14, Psalm 34:7, Luke 15:10, and Daniel 10:13.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Son of Man's coming as stated in Matthew 18?
options: To establish a kingdom on earth
questions.correctAnswer: To save the lost
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:11 clarifies Jesus' mission to save those who are lost, consistent with Luke 19:10, John 3:17, Isaiah 53:6, and Ezekiel 34:16.

questions.question: In the parable of the lost sheep, what does the shepherd do when one sheep goes astray?
options: Leaves the ninety-nine and seeks the lost one
Waits for the sheep to return
Gives up on the lost sheep
questions.correctAnswer: Leaves the ninety-nine and seeks the lost one
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:12 describes the shepherd's pursuit of the lost sheep, showing God's loving pursuit of sinners, paralleling Luke 15:4-7, Ezekiel 34:11-16, Psalm 23:1-3, and John 10:11-14.

questions.question: What is the desired will of the Father regarding 'one of these little ones' perishing?
options: That only the righteous should perish
questions.correctAnswer: That none should perish
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:14 affirms God's will that none of His children perish, consistent with 2 Peter 3:9, Ezekiel 33:11, John 6:39, and Romans 8:38-39.

questions.question: What is the first step Jesus instructs to take when a brother sins against you?
options: Go and tell him his fault between you and him alone
questions.correctAnswer: Go and tell him his fault between you and him alone
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:15 teaches private confrontation for reconciliation, reflecting principles in Galatians 6:1, James 5:19-20, Leviticus 19:17, and Proverbs 27:5-6.

questions.question: If the offender does not listen to you alone, what does Jesus advise as the next step?
options: Take one or two more witnesses
questions.correctAnswer: Take one or two more witnesses
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:16 prescribes involving witnesses to establish truth, consistent with Deuteronomy 19:15, 2 Corinthians 13:1, Proverbs 18:17, and Numbers 35:30.

questions.question: What authority is given to the church when a person refuses to listen even to witnesses?
options: To treat him as a heathen and a publican
To send him away without judgment
questions.correctAnswer: To treat him as a heathen and a publican
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:17 instructs the church to discipline unrepentant sinners by treating them as outsiders, reflecting Matthew 16:19, 1 Corinthians 5:11-13, Titus 3:10-11, and 2 Thessalonians 3:6.

questions.question: What promise does Jesus give about agreement in prayer among believers?
options: If two agree on earth about anything asked, it will be done by the Father in heaven
Only the leader's prayers will be answered
questions.correctAnswer: If two agree on earth about anything asked, it will be done by the Father in heaven
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:19 promises answered prayer when believers agree, consistent with John 14:13-14, James 5:16, 1 John 5:14-15, and Philippians 4:6-7.

questions.question: What does Jesus say about His presence when two or three are gathered in His name?
options: He is there in the midst of them
questions.correctAnswer: He is there in the midst of them
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:20 assures the real presence of Christ among gathered believers, reflecting Hebrews 10:25, Exodus 33:14, Psalm 22:3, and John 14:23.

questions.question: How often does Jesus say we should forgive a brother who sins against us?
questions.correctAnswer: Until seventy times seven
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches in Matthew 18:22 to forgive without limit, illustrating God's boundless mercy, consistent with Luke 17:3-4, Colossians 3:13, Ephesians 4:32, and Psalm 103:12.

questions.question: What lesson does the parable of the unforgiving servant teach about forgiveness?
options: We must forgive others as God forgives us
We should only forgive those who pay us back
God will forgive regardless of our actions
questions.correctAnswer: We must forgive others as God forgives us
questions.explanation: Matthew 18:23-35 illustrates God's mercy and demands similar mercy from His followers, aligned with Luke 6:37, Mark 11:25, Ephesians 4:32, and 1 John 1:9.
